trans-unit.source: Describes how to use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager MMC snap-in to create and manage the backup policies that control scheduled backups.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to use the StorSimple Snapshot Manager MMC snap-in to create and manage the backup policies that control scheduled backups.

trans-unit.source: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to create and manage backup policies
trans-unit.target: Use StorSimple Snapshot Manager to create and manage backup policies

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: A backup policy creates a schedule for backing up volume data locally or in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: A backup policy creates a schedule for backing up volume data locally or in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: When you create a backup policy, you can also specify a retention policy.
trans-unit.target: When you create a backup policy, you can also specify a retention policy.

trans-unit.source: (You can retain a maximum of 64 snapshots.) For more information about backup policies, see [Backup types and backup policies](storsimple-what-is-snapshot-manager.md#backup-types-and-backup-policies).
trans-unit.target: (You can retain a maximum of 64 snapshots.) For more information about backup policies, see [Backup types and backup policies](storsimple-what-is-snapshot-manager.md#backup-types-and-backup-policies).

trans-unit.source: To create a backup policy
trans-unit.target: To create a backup policy

trans-unit.source: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.
trans-unit.target: Click the desktop icon to start StorSimple Snapshot Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the **Scope** pane, right-click **Backup Policies**, and click **Create Backup Policy**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Scope** pane, right-click **Backup Policies**, and click **Create Backup Policy**.

trans-unit.source: Create a backup policy
trans-unit.target: Create a backup policy

trans-unit.source: The **Create a Policy** dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Create a Policy** dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: Create a Policy - General tab
trans-unit.target: Create a Policy - General tab

trans-unit.source: On the **General** tab, complete the following information:
trans-unit.target: On the **General** tab, complete the following information:

trans-unit.source: In the **Name** text box, type a name for the policy.
trans-unit.target: In the **Name** text box, type a name for the policy.

trans-unit.source: In the** Volume group **text box, type the name of the volume group associated with the policy.
trans-unit.target: In the** Volume group **text box, type the name of the volume group associated with the policy.

trans-unit.source: Select either **Local Snapshot** or **Cloud Snapshot**.
trans-unit.target: Select either **Local Snapshot** or **Cloud Snapshot**.

trans-unit.source: Select the number of snapshots to retain.
trans-unit.target: Select the number of snapshots to retain.

trans-unit.source: If you select **All**, 64 snapshots will be retained (the maximum).
trans-unit.target: If you select **All**, 64 snapshots will be retained (the maximum).

trans-unit.source: Click the **Schedule** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Schedule** tab.

trans-unit.source: Create a Policy - Schedule tab
trans-unit.target: Create a Policy - Schedule tab

trans-unit.source: On the **Schedule** tab, complete the following information:
trans-unit.target: On the **Schedule** tab, complete the following information:

trans-unit.source: Click the **Enable** check box to schedule the next backup.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Enable** check box to schedule the next backup.

trans-unit.source: Under **Settings**, select **One time**, **Daily**, **Weekly**, or **Monthly**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Settings**, select **One time**, **Daily**, **Weekly**, or **Monthly**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Start** text box, click the calendar icon and select a start date.
trans-unit.target: In the **Start** text box, click the calendar icon and select a start date.

trans-unit.source: Under **Advanced Settings**, you can set optional repeat schedules and an end date.
trans-unit.target: Under **Advanced Settings**, you can set optional repeat schedules and an end date.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: After you create a backup policy, the following information appears in the **Results** pane:
trans-unit.target: After you create a backup policy, the following information appears in the **Results** pane:

trans-unit.source: **Name** – the name of backup policy.
trans-unit.target: **Name** – the name of backup policy.

trans-unit.source: **Type** – local snapshot or cloud snapshot.
trans-unit.target: **Type** – local snapshot or cloud snapshot.

trans-unit.source: **Volume Group** – the volume group associated with the policy.
trans-unit.target: **Volume Group** – the volume group associated with the policy.

trans-unit.source: **Retention** – the number of snapshots retained; the maximum is 64.
trans-unit.target: **Retention** – the number of snapshots retained; the maximum is 64.

trans-unit.source: **Created** – the date that this policy was created.
trans-unit.target: **Created** – the date that this policy was created.

trans-unit.source: **Enabled** – whether the policy is currently in effect: **True** indicates that it is in effect; **False** indicates that it is not in effect.
trans-unit.target: **Enabled** – whether the policy is currently in effect: **True** indicates that it is in effect; **False** indicates that it is not in effect.
